moral-setback-example: I am thinking of the storming of the Al-Aqsa Mosque by Israeli troops during services where Palestinians were worshiping during Ramadan services, resulting in hundreds of arrests and multiple injuries, at one of the holiest sites in Islam and also Judaism.  This obviously inflames historical tensions and strains moral cohesion in intercommunity relations, setting back the interests of both.
open-ended-why: I believe it is true, because people are fallible, as are communities and relations among them.  So although I believe that human beings are primarily inclined to be good and have moral sense, the exercise of morality and the concept of what that is, both in close relationships and with others (broadly speaking) presents challenges which are characteristic of the human condition also.  So this is something that people have to work on, more or less inevitably.  Also, it is consistent with human desires to make the world better that moral progress occurs.

moral-setback-example: One recent example of when moral progress has not occurred is the surge in anti-Asian hate crimes and incidents that have occurred in the United States and other countries in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic. Despite decades of progress in promoting equality and diversity, the pandemic has fueled a rise in xenophobic and racist attitudes towards people of Asian descent, with many individuals being unfairly blamed and scapegoated for the spread of the virus.

moral-setback-example: Abortion rights and the right of people born female to have bodily autonomy are being stripped away by certain government officials in the USA.
open-ended-why: Yes, this is true because if we don't take action, then the action of others is what occurs. Progress is something that has to be maintained or else those who oppose it will have their way and dissolve progress. It all goes back to the tolerance paradox, where tolerating intolerance leads to intolerance. Our actions and inactions always have consequences whether good or bad. Taking a back seat puts someone else in the driver's seat. No matter spirituality, action is what gets things done.
